raw_response:
```json
[
  {"entry_number": 1, "date": "2025-04-15", "content": "Two years. The milestone feels like a fragile glass bird. Still learning to breathe without the old crutch. The page remains a silent sentinel."},
  {"entry_number": 2, "date": "2025-04-18", "content": "Coffee with Liam. The air was thick with unspoken apologies. A small crack in the dam, but the river flows slow. Felt a flicker of connection."},
  {"entry_number": 3, "date": "2025-04-21", "content": "The blank document mocks me. My inner critic, a sharp-toothed beast, stalks every idea. Tried freewriting. Just tangled strings."},
  {"entry_number": 4, "date": "2025-04-24", "content": "Dr. Chen listened to my anxieties. She called them \"ghosts of the past.\" A helpful perspective. My sobriety feels like a tightly held breath sometimes."},
  {"entry_number": 5, "date": "2025-04-27", "content": "Walked by the old bar. The phantom pull was strong, a siren's song. Gripped my keys tight. Another battle won, but the war lingers."},
  {"entry_number": 6, "date": "2025-04-30", "content": "A sentence finally emerged, like a sprout through concrete. Small victory. Maybe the words aren't entirely dead, just sleeping deeply. A faint hope."},
  {"entry_number": 7, "date": "2025-05-03", "content": "Called Mom. Her voice was cautious, like walking on ice. My heart aches for the lost years, the fractured reflection in her eyes. It's hard."},
  {"entry_number": 8, "date": "2025-05-06", "content": "Therapy today. Discussed the \"elephant in the room\" with Mom. Dr. Chen suggests small, consistent efforts. Patience is a foreign language to me."},
  {"entry_number": 9, "date": "2025-05-09", "content": "Finished a short story draft! It's messy, but it exists. A small flame in the dark. The creative well isn't entirely dry after all."},
  {"entry_number": 10, "date": "2025-05-12", "content": "Received a text from Chloe. \"Thinking of you.\" A soft whisper from a damaged past. My chest tightened. What does this mean?"},
  {"entry_number": 11, "date": "2025-05-15", "content": "Met Chloe for tea. Awkward smiles, careful words. The bridge between us is still broken in places. But we talked. A start, maybe."},
  {"entry_number": 12, "date": "2025-05-18", "content": "My mind feels like a hummingbird trapped in a glass jar. So much nervous energy, nowhere to put it. Struggled to focus on edits."},
  {"entry_number": 13, "date": "2025-05-21", "content": "Therapy. Explored the guilt I carry like a heavy cloak. Dr. Chen says forgiveness starts within. A daunting mountain to climb."},
  {"entry_number": 14, "date": "2025-05-24", "content": "The sun felt warm on my face today. Found an old journal; my past self felt so distant, almost a stranger. A different kind of reflection."},
  {"entry_number": 15, "date": "2025-05-27", "content": "Sent a revised short story to a literary magazine. Heart pounding. It feels like sending a message in a bottle out to sea. Hopeful."},
  {"entry_number": 16, "date": "2025-05-30", "content": "Saw an old drinking buddy at the grocery store. My stomach dropped. Just a nod, but the encounter left an unsettling residue. Stayed strong."},
  {"entry_number": 17, "date": "2025-06-02", "content": "Dr. Chen spoke about triggers. That grocery store incident was definitely one. A reminder that vigilance is my constant companion."},
  {"entry_number": 18, "date": "2025-06-05", "content": "Brainstormed ideas for a new novel. It feels like chasing fireflies in the dark. So many glittering possibilities, so few I can catch."},
  {"entry_number": 19, "date": "2025-06-08", "content": "Had dinner with my sister, Sarah. Less tense than Mom. She mentioned my writing. A small affirmation, like watering a wilting plant."},
  {"entry_number": 20, "date": "2025-06-11", "content": "The words are flowing again, a gentle stream. Working on character sketches. It feels good to build something new, brick by careful brick."},
  {"entry_number": 21, "date": "2025-06-14", "content": "Therapy today. We discussed managing expectations for relationship repair. Slow growth, not instant healing. A hard truth, but necessary."},
  {"entry_number": 22, "date": "2025-06-17", "content": "A rejection slip arrived. My story wasn't accepted. A familiar sting. The creative path is paved with these little heartbreaks. I persist."},
  {"entry_number": 23, "date": "2025-06-20", "content": "Called Liam to apologize for snapping yesterday. The fragility of these rebuilt connections is terrifying. He understood. A small relief."},
  {"entry_number": 24, "date": "2025-06-23", "content": "Read some poetry. It felt like balm for my spirit. Remembering why I love words, even when they seem to desert me. Renewed energy."},
  {"entry_number": 25, "date": "2025-06-26", "content": "Dr. Chen helped me reframe the rejection. A \"detour,\" not a dead end. My worth isn't tied to publication. Still, it smarts."},
  {"entry_number": 26, "date": "2025-06-29", "content": "Spent the entire day world-building for the novel. Lost myself in the map of my imagination. A wonderful escape, yet productive."},
  {"entry_number": 27, "date": "2025-07-02", "content": "My sobriety feels more stable now, less like walking on thin ice. More like firm ground, but I never forget the chasm below."},
  {"entry_number": 28, "date": "2025-07-05", "content": "Went to a picnic with Chloe and her kids. Laughter felt good, unfamiliar. A glimpse of what could be, if I'm brave enough."},
  {"entry_number": 29, "date": "2025-07-08", "content": "Therapy. Talked about the joy and fear of new connections. The past casts a long shadow, but Dr. Chen says I can choose where to stand."},
  {"entry_number": 30, "date": "2025-07-11", "content": "Got a compliment on my writing from a workshop peer. A small boost to my often-fragile confidence. The muse smiles faintly."},
  {"entry_number": 31, "date": "2025-07-14", "content": "The heat makes me restless. Tried to write, but my mind felt like a buzzing hive. Took a long walk instead. Needed the quiet."},
  {"entry_number": 32, "date": "2025-07-17", "content": "Sent another short story out. The hope is a delicate butterfly. This time, I feel less attached to the outcome. Progress, maybe."},
  {"entry_number": 33, "date": "2025-07-20", "content": "Mom called, just to chat, no agenda. It felt... lighter. Like a tiny stone removed from my heart. Healing is a slow unfolding."},
  {"entry_number": 34, "date": "2025-07-23", "content": "Therapy session focused on self-compassion. I'm so hard on myself. Dr. Chen said to treat myself like I'd treat a friend. Difficult."},
  {"entry_number": 35, "date": "2025-07-26", "content": "Had a dream about drinking. Woke up in a cold sweat. The old fear still lurks in the subconscious depths. A reminder to stay vigilant."},
  {"entry_number": 36, "date": "2025-07-29", "content": "My character is finally speaking to me. Her voice is clear. The novel is beginning to take root, a sapling reaching for the sun."},
  {"entry_number": 37, "date": "2025-08-01", "content": "The news today was heavy. Felt a familiar urge to numb the edges. Instead, I journaled. My pen is my new anchor."},
  {"entry_number": 38, "date": "2025-08-04", "content": "Liam helped me move some boxes. His quiet presence is a comfort. Rebuilding trust is like weaving a strong rope, strand by careful strand."},
  {"entry_number": 39, "date": "2025-08-07", "content": "Therapy. Explored the concept of \"radical acceptance.\" Accepting what is, without judgment. A challenging, liberating idea. Still practicing."},
  {"entry_number": 40, "date": "2025-08-10", "content": "A productive writing day. Hit a flow state where time dissolved. It's moments like these that remind me why I push through the blocks."},
  {"entry_number": 41, "date": "2025-08-13", "content": "Chloe invited me to her daughter's school play. A small, joyful step into her current life. My past self would've scoffed."},
  {"entry_number": 42, "date": "2025-08-16", "content": "Felt overwhelmed by the sheer volume of work on the novel. A mountain range stretching to the horizon. Just have to take one step."},
  {"entry_number": 43, "date": "2025-08-19", "content": "My sister Sarah just bought a house. Happy for her, but a pang of envy. My own life feels less rooted, more adrift."},
  {"entry_number": 44, "date": "2025-08-22", "content": "Therapy. Discussed comparing my journey to others. Dr. Chen reminded me my path is unique. My \"roots\" are in my recovery and creativity."},
  {"entry_number": 45, "date": "2025-08-25", "content": "Received an email – my second short story was accepted! A rush of pure, unadulterated joy. The creative wellspring runs again."},
  {"entry_number": 46, "date": "2025-08-28", "content": "Celebrated the acceptance with a fancy non-alcoholic drink. It tasted like triumph. A reminder that joy doesn't need to be chemically enhanced."},
  {"entry_number": 47, "date": "2025-08-31", "content": "Spent the morning editing. The words feel alive, vibrant. This is what it feels like to be truly connected to my purpose."},
  {"entry_number": 48, "date": "2025-09-03", "content": "Had a difficult conversation with Dad. He's still holding onto a lot of anger. It felt like walking through a minefield. Left me drained."},
  {"entry_number": 49, "date": "2025-09-06", "content": "Therapy helped me process Dad's anger. Dr. Chen said his pain is not mine to fix. Just to acknowledge. That's a huge lesson."},
  {"entry_number": 50, "date": "2025-09-09", "content": "Reread old entries. A stark contrast to where I am now. The progress is a winding path, but I've climbed some impressive hills."},
  {"entry_number": 51, "date": "2025-09-12", "content": "The novel plot points are starting to click into place. It's like finding the missing pieces of a complex puzzle. Exciting!"},
  {"entry_number": 52, "date": "2025-09-15", "content": "Three years sober. The glass bird has found its wings. I'm still careful, but the fear is less encompassing. A quiet strength."},
  {"entry_number": 53, "date": "2025-09-18", "content": "Went to a friend's wedding. Open bar everywhere. My anxiety flared, but I held my ground. Focused on the happy couple. My resolve held."},
  {"entry_number": 54, "date": "2025-09-21", "content": "Therapy after the wedding. Discussed my coping mechanisms. I noticed the triggers, felt the pull, and made a conscious choice. That's growth."},
  {"entry_number": 55, "date": "2025-09-24", "content": "Writing a challenging scene in the novel. It requires deep emotional honesty. Feels like peeling back my own skin. Raw, but necessary."},
  {"entry_number": 56, "date": "2025-09-27", "content": "Had a really good laugh with Chloe today. Genuine, unrestrained. The sound was like music, a reminder of what I'd almost lost forever."},
  {"entry_number": 57, "date": "2025-09-30", "content": "Took a break from writing to read. Sometimes I forget to nourish my own wellspring. It’s important to absorb, not just produce."},
  {"entry_number": 58, "date": "2025-10-03", "content": "My editor sent notes on the short story. Mostly positive! A thrill. My creative voice is finding its resonance."},
  {"entry_number": 59, "date": "2025-10-06", "content": "Therapy session. Dr. Chen asked about my vision for the future. It’s no longer just about survival, but about thriving. A new horizon."},
  {"entry_number": 60, "date": "2025-10-09", "content": "The novel is gaining momentum. Pages are accumulating, a growing pile of words. The story is finding its own path."},
  {"entry_number": 61, "date": "2025-10-12", "content": "Had lunch with Mom and Dad. It was... pleasant. Not fully healed, but the ice has thinned. A delicate dance of reconciliation."},
  {"entry_number": 62, "date": "2025-10-15", "content": "The autumn leaves are falling like old memories. A sense of letting go, of shedding what no longer serves me. Beautiful, and a little sad."},
  {"entry_number": 63, "date": "2025-10-18", "content": "Struggled with a character's motivation. Felt stuck in quicksand. Sometimes the creative process demands a retreat, not a charge."},
  {"entry_number": 64, "date": "2025-10-21", "content": "Therapy. Discussed perfectionism and its creative stranglehold. Dr. Chen suggests \"good enough\" is sometimes revolutionary. A challenging concept for me."},
  {"entry_number": 65, "date": "2025-10-24", "content": "Woke up feeling heavy. A low-grade melancholy, like a persistent fog. Didn't write much. Just existing felt like an effort today."},

  {"entry_number": 67, "date": "2025-10-30", "content": "Pushed through the fog. Wrote a difficult chapter. The words felt like pulling teeth, but they came. Small victory against resistance."},
  {"entry_number": 68, "date": "2025-11-02", "content": "Therapy today. Addressed the recent dip in mood. Dr. Chen reminded me that recovery isn't linear. It's okay to have off days."},
  {"entry_number": 69, "date": "2025-11-05", "content": "My short story is officially published online! Seeing my name, my words, in print. A powerful affirmation. Tears welled up."},
  {"entry_number": 70, "date": "2025-11-08", "content": "Shared the published story with Mom and Sarah. They were genuinely proud. That feels like a warm embrace, a reconnection."},
  {"entry_number": 71, "date": "2025-11-11", "content": "The novel is really taking shape now. I see the ending, shimmering like a mirage on the horizon. The journey feels purposeful."},
  {"entry_number": 72, "date": "2025-11-14", "content": "Dr. Chen and I talked about managing success and the fear it brings. It's a new kind of vulnerability. Still learning to embrace it."},
  {"entry_number": 73, "date": "2025-11-17", "content": "A small party invitation for the holidays. My first sober holiday gathering. The thought sends shivers down my spine."},
  {"entry_number": 74, "date": "2025-11-20", "content": "Prepped for the party. Visualized saying \"no thank you\" to drinks. Rehearsed my exit strategy. It feels like preparing for battle."},
  {"entry_number": 75, "date": "2025-11-23", "content": "The party was... okay. A few awkward questions, but I held firm. Left early. Exhausted, but my sobriety is stronger."},
  {"entry_number": 76, "date": "2025-11-26", "content": "Therapy today. Discussed the holiday party. Dr. Chen celebrated my boundaries. \"That's self-care,\" she said. A good reminder."},
  {"entry_number": 77, "date": "2025-11-29", "content": "Thanksgiving was quiet with Mom and Sarah. Less tension, more genuine connection. A sense of gratitude washes over me."},
  {"entry_number": 78, "date": "2025-12-02", "content": "The novel's climax is proving tricky. Like threading a needle in the dark. Pushed through it, but left feeling a bit battered."},
  {"entry_number": 79, "date": "2025-12-05", "content": "Chloe and I went ice skating. Felt childlike joy, something I haven't felt in years. The cold air invigorated my spirit."},
  {"entry_number": 80, "date": "2025-12-08", "content": "Therapy. Talked about the unexpected joy. Dr. Chen reminds me to savor these moments. They are the true fuel for my journey."},
  {"entry_number": 81, "date": "2025-12-11", "content": "The first draft of the novel is almost done. It feels like reaching the peak of a long, arduous climb. Exhausted, but triumphant."},
  {"entry_number": 82, "date": "2025-12-14", "content": "Had coffee with an old writing mentor. She read my short story and was so encouraging. Her belief is a strong wind at my back."},
  {"entry_number": 83, "date": "2025-12-17", "content": "Holiday lights are everywhere. They feel less oppressive this year, more festive. A quiet wonder at the simple beauty."},
  {"entry_number": 84, "date": "2025-12-20", "content": "Therapy today. Dr. Chen and I reflected on the year. So much growth, so many battles won. My landscape has changed."},
  {"entry_number": 85, "date": "2025-12-23", "content": "Submitted the first draft of the novel to a trusted beta reader. The vulnerability is immense, like sending my heart out to sea."},
  {"entry_number": 86, "date": "2025-12-26", "content": "Christmas was calm. Enjoyed the simple presence of family. No drama, just quiet connection. A profound gift."},

  {"entry_number": 88, "date": "2026-01-01", "content": "Happy New Year. Made resolutions: embrace vulnerability, write with courage, deepen connections. My sobriety is my unwavering North Star."},
  {"entry_number": 89, "date": "2026-01-04", "content": "Therapy. Set new goals for the coming months. Dr. Chen affirmed my progress. It's a journey, not a destination."},
  {"entry_number": 90, "date": "2026-01-07", "content": "Beta reader feedback arrived. It's a lot, but mostly constructive. My novel has a pulse, a breath. Now, the refining begins."},
  {"entry_number": 91, "date": "2026-01-10", "content": "Tackling revisions. It's like sculpting a block of marble. Hard work, but the form is emerging. The story wants to be told."},
  {"entry_number": 92, "date": "2026-01-13", "content": "Went to a bookstore. Held new releases, felt the paper. A dream, seeing my own novel on these shelves someday. A powerful motivator."},
  {"entry_number": 93, "date": "2026-01-16", "content": "Therapy today. Talked about dealing with criticism for my novel. Separate the art from the artist, she said. Easier said than done."},
  {"entry_number": 94, "date": "2026-01-19", "content": "My relationship with Mom feels genuinely softer. We talked about memories, not resentments. A gentle unfolding, like a winter flower."},
  {"entry_number": 95, "date": "2026-01-22", "content": "The revisions are intense, but rewarding. Each word feels more precise, each sentence stronger. My craft is sharpening."},
  {"entry_number": 96, "date": "2026-01-25", "content": "Had a rare moment of doubt. The whispers of \"not good enough\" crept in. Took a deep breath, reminded myself of how far I've come."},
  {"entry_number": 97, "date": "2026-01-28", "content": "Liam and I planned a weekend getaway. Just a cabin, quiet. A chance to simply *be*, without expectation. Looking forward to it."},
  {"entry_number": 98, "date": "2026-01-31", "content": "Therapy. Dr. Chen noted my growing self-reliance and peace. The seeds planted months ago are blooming. A profound sense of gratitude."},
  {"entry_number": 99, "date": "2026-02-03", "content": "The novel is almost ready for agent submission. A monumental step. My creative journey feels like a river, ever flowing onward."},
```
